intro: Scleria cheekii, commonly known as the Cape Province sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and wetlands. Scleria cheekii has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in humid environments and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
